comments.body: I REALLY want this implemented in the game
Then it finally wouldn´t be such a hassle to Light out your Base
I think this would be good for Minecraft

I believe that the Java edition has a toggle for sneak. If that feature was in Bedrock, I think that would solve your problems, as you could just hit shift once to sneak, and your character would stay crouched   even when you enter an inventory.
This would be help! Please we need it.
Must-have feature
Would definitely be good not only for PC, but also for all consoles (including switch mojang I see u)
Would love to have this as a quality of life improvement.
This will make Minecraft way better

I agree! Possibly the implementation of a dropdown menu like that which can be found in the video settings for UI Profile where you can choose between 'Classic' and 'Pocket' or even an option similar to the 'GUI scale modifier' but for the chat window in-game would allow for a far smoother experience.

Oh yeah, also if you're a fast typer (like me) then sometimes you are typing whilst the animation is playing to open the chat window which either: cuts off the first part of a word, or the chat doesn't even record what you're typing.
Yes, I agree much with this post, the animation is the most annoying thing ever.
That is one of the most good ideas ive heard of!
I agree, it's very annoying and should be fixed!
It’s so annoying. I liked the java chat better. Bedrock chat is in the way.
You can use a mouse and keyboard

Agreed, it’s quite irritating to have all that wasted screen space. It would be great to be able to assign one player or perhaps the first to log in to have the full wide screen like in two player mode.

I submitted a request for this exact thing, but then found this. It is such an overlooked feature to have the first or third or (whichever player you choose in settings) to have 1/2 the screen while the remaining players stay at 1/4 of the screen. Why not? It's been a feature in older split-screen games for ages.

I believe making the option to choose who gets the half screen, via the settings, is a great idea.
What will it look like when its 3 players?
Agreed!  I’d like this capability as well.  Though I’d also like the keyboard to work at all...
I would also love the option to remap keys.

I agree that there should be a way to look around without changing how you're flying.  It's a tough balance when looking for end cities, especially when the chunks are refusing to load fast enough.  It would be great to set my elytra at an optimum slow glide angle and then be free to look around and see what I can see.
Yeah, no kidding.
Of course we need something like that.
i think this should be a use for the Dragon Head. great idea! hope it gets added!
This looks like a pretty old UI, don’t you think?
Why does it look like Protocol Version 3 for some reason

I disagree. We already have a toggle, and it's called mods vs. no mods. The amount of realism and detail you can achieve with some mods/texture packs/shaders is unreal.

The fact that you can customize your experience to be practically whatever you want it to be is part of the beauty of this game. But to split Minecraft into a "classic" half and a "realistic" half would be a terrible idea.
stampy lovely world
I agree, Minecraft PC players always had the advantage against Minecraft Mobile players ever since they combined both versions.
BuilderJayMC ya and servers wer highly advertised for 1.2 and they didnt even think about seperating the platforms so it could be more fun and fair for users its mainly why i quit playing servers.

@SeanMinecraftPE I know exactly how you feel. But if you ask PC players on servers, they will always say it's perfectly fair, but they're the ones dominating 90% of the time. I had a PC player literally build a wall around me in two seconds while tying their shoelaces and brewing a latte, while I just sat there, try to get out of a crafting bench I accidentally pressed, because 'attack' and 'open' are both a tap.
Also add the ability to change the D pad to a joystick control on mobile... i’d like to see a joystick like in among us.
we need this
1. I wanted to create a custom upgrade menu for my MMORPG server. It’s a nice idea.
It totally makes sense
Maybe add a dedicated button bind for taking screenshots.

I think I can remember it being an realms exclusive feature (aka you could only take screenshots on realms for realms stories) and thinking why it was like this. The only think to add /  change is to make keybinding (F2) for it. But yeah great change / new feature Mojang

It would be great if screenshots were saved in a lossless format instead of a compressed format by default. This would really help prevent the quality from decreasing the more times the image is shared or copied. In addition, a native way to export the screenshot so it can be saved directly onto the players device would be great for PC and mobile users.
It so good in mobile

I like this feature and I realise it's new and will be expanded upon.

One thing I use screenshots for is when I design something in Creative to use in Survival.

If there was a key bind to directly access the images that would be really good, as at the moment it takes longer to get to them than is used to refer to them. In Survival that could be dangerous.

Also a way to share/access them from outside the game would be appreciated.
It would be such a nice quality of life feature if there was way to multi select screenshots and share them in bulk!

It would be great to have a dedicated button to enter the screenshot folder on the harddrive. Also an option to select where screenshots are saved on the harddrive. At the moment it's completely user-unfriendly.
Yes it is such a pain and if they could add buttons to drop and item from your hot bar with a tap and not a really long hold like it is now
It would also be cool if they added the ability to hold more the a few items in you off hand they could do this by adding two buttons one for each hand in the game
They could also add in a way to customize where the buttons are on the screen not just how big they are.

Its so hard to play without a split control.I saw so many player rage quit mcpe pvp for that.But mojang acts like they doesnt care .Probably cause they have a massive community on java edition that they dont need mobile version to be that popular.Well thats so sad but going to uninstall because of it.Thought never gonna say it but buying mcpe on mobile is just a waste of money.RIP mobile players
That at is a good idea since I don’t really like looking at the nether one .
This is a really good and solid idea and I wish this was in the game.

This is a nice idea, I wish I could go back to the 1.18 panorama with the mountains, it's already possible as some resource packs change the background panorama anyways, it would be really easy to implement.

Absolutely totally agree with this.

Have my own server and am admin on the same server as Dennari.

It makes it very difficult to catch the cheats.

Please please please can team settings override the settings related to the spectator gamemode.
This would be cool if it were an option in the settings of Minecraft bedrock

No, why, just click f3 or remember what the biome looks like
Or just not do anything because you don't need to know the biome name

In Java Minecraft this was a feature of the F3 button. At any time, you could check what biome you are in. Now in Bedrock there is no way to find out what biome you are in. It is a bit frustrating. It would be nice to have something somewhere that would show what biome you are in.

Yeah -- as previously stated there isn't an F3 menu in Bedrock (not sure why not), i wouldn't be upset if that was implemented in Bedrock either. However, the issue isn't "what it looks like" as you also have to think underground. in a tunnel, am I still in the same biome? It's becoming more important for things like breeding.
Yess please. I Can't even play hammer bc it gives me nausea
@Berserage1223 There already is one it's called View Bobbing You can turn it's of to stop the shake
390152169232 where is it located please ? I can't find it.
The view bobbing option is located in the video section

I play in a server where there are custom mobs and armour and always have a terrible headache in dungeons while fighting massive amount of mobs, my camera doesn't stop from shaking and that's just inresistable, so please fix this...
of course

Yes! I often have minecraft running in the background and it's a hassle to have to go to the sounds menu and move the slider each time I'm switching between minecraft and whatever else I'm doing. A keyboard shortcut and a button on the main menu to mute all sounds would be nice.
Definitely this! Having to go through several sub menus just to mute the game is simply annoying if you have to do it several times a day.
even a keyboard shortcut would be helpful!
Yes!
i love the minecraft music but sometimes I prefer listening to something else in the background so it gets very annoying TwT
someone needs to make a texture pack to bring it back
I really hope whoever made that update realises their mistake and changes it in time for 1.15.1
Please remove those outlines! Or if not just make them toggleable in the settings.
when using the "Programmer Art" resource pack, it brings back the correct highlights for all but the accessibility icon in the title screen.

Good news! Using programmer's art, the old beautiful blue/yellow buttons are back again.

I really hope they keep the programmer's art as long as Minecraft exists, so Mojang can make UI/texture changes based on whatever whim they have, without me having to see them.

Honestly I cannot stand the outline look. I'm unsure who thought it was such a great idea to implement it. It definitely isn't only my brain hurting.

It could make sense to make the buttons use that style in a high contrast setting (say, available as an accessibility feature), but I doubt that's ever gonna happen.

Using the Programmer Art until this is either resolved or when I find the energy to throw the buttons into a resource pack.

Programmer Art no longer changes the text colour to be yellow anymore, and they might have removed the ability to add that to resource packs. New buttons look like garbage, bedrock ui is indeed terrible, the Xp bar in bedrock is god awful too.

Looking back at this, perhaps a shuffle option could be present, and the "song name box" element could be instead turned into a "time tracking text" element which would just display the current temporal position in the song and the total duration.

Also, I've considered increasing the amount of storage for discs from 2 pages to the same amount of space in a large chest. Instead of using pages to navigate storage, it would likely be another scrollbar element.
Freinds
No puedo agregar amigos me dice que la configuración no está activa para eso
Need friends
I completely agree with you man it would be REALLY handy if they added that feature in.

I don't think they will ever add it. The inventory alrrady gives you 64, witch I also want to be removed - creative mode building dosen't consume items, this was made for crafting or something. YOU HAVE MIDDLE-CLICK OR SHIFT-CLICK TO GET 64! I really like it gives you ONE ITEM by default in Java. Also I want stack numbers to be shown in the hotbar.
You can do it in Java, but not Bedrock- at least allow acess to the creative menu while opening a chest.

Really good idea. This would be super useful if you died in a really hot location with a lot of hostile mobs or obstacles in survival, and when you revisit that area all your items are picked up and put in random locations in your inventory. Lots of time your weapons don't collect in your hotbar, and maybe the time it takes to find it and switch it is too long when you have 6 or 7 mobs chasing you. Would be really useful. 

Heres a situation to consider though: pretend you have recollected every item from your last death and it all went into the selected places for it in your inventory. Maybe one item is missing from its appropriate slot and that slot is the only open slot in your inventory. When you go to pick up another item that doesn't fit into that slot that you pre-adjusted, how could you pick it up? Maybe a hotkey you can press while the crosshair is on the item entity on the ground that pretty much means "override the slot preference, I want to pick up this item on the ground"

Thanks for your comment!

I meant for you to ALWAYS automatically pick up items. If there's no empty slot without a preference, and the item that you're attempting to pick up does not fit the slot, the preference should be ignored and overridden. Picking up items is prioritized if there's a conflict.

 

( I meant to say that in the first point of When to ignore a preference but I didn't mention that it was about picking up an item)
Great idea! Have you ever tried killing 10 zombies with a block of dirt?
